intro: Disporum trachyandrum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed disporum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Native to the western United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. Its botanical features make it an important component of its ecological habitat.
